text: Small mall for local finds and thrift shops. We also found a great store for hair extensions and wigs. Plus a bonus here is a small boutique run by two women who design denim wear, it’s an absolute must visit(bonus, their clothing isn’t expensive at all)

A shopping centre mainly selling Ladies fashions, Muslim related products and many remittance shops. Surprised to find that all the shops in this 3 storeys shopping centre were in operation when we visit on a weekday afternoon.  There a few good Malay style halal restaurants that worth trying out. Yes, its a old mall but its had being well maintained. Clean and organised.

All under one roof
Eateries, wedding halls, shops etc.
Reasonably priced
Recommended
Very nostalgic from the time I visited when I was a student . Popular place for Indonesian maids and gets crowded especially on Sunday. Some good deals plus my all time favourite Arnold’s chicken

City Plaza
810 Geylang Rd, Singapore
City Plaza: Singapore's Bargain Hunter Paradise!
Shhh... don't let the unassuming facade fool you. City Plaza is a hidden gem tucked away in Singapore, a compact powerhouse waiting to unleash its treasures upon the savvy shopper. Forget the chrome and glass giants, this three-story labyrinth pulsates with a retro vibe and a local energy that's infectious.
